title: What type of k-pop fans are there? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ok, I will try to cover as many as I can remember: Over talker - whether you text them or talk to them in real life, the only thing they will talk about is kpop. Like they will talk about it so much that you might secretly wish they would talk about something else.Networker - this person will usually be found on social media in the comments section talking about how great their group is. Always promoting. Always. You will usually see them under multiple posts talking about their ult. groupStreamer - let’s get ___ group’s mv to 100 million views! BTS has reached __ views, can we get them to ___ views?? Pretty self explanatory.Wise owl - knows even the most unknown facts about their group. Like things that you never even heard about. Most likely to also participate in fan theories.Fake fan - identifies with a group’s fandom, but is usually only there to get clout or hate on the group.OT# - Proudly says that their bias is the all the members in a group. Sometimes condescending if you don’t do OT7 (or whatever number of members the group has).Has a bias, but loves all members - they have a certain member in the group that is their bias, but they love and appreciate all the other members as well.Solo stans - some of them are nice and respectful, but most of them are super toxic and let everyone know that “ __ member is superior, and is better off being solo a than in a group.”CEO stan - doesn’t stan a group, but rather a company. They let that dictate which groups they follow. Company first, groups second.Award show obsessed - high key willing to do whatever it takes to get their group that daesang award. Usually will make multiple accounts just to vote for one award show. Also knows of every award show and tells everyone they know to vote!Content creators - they will usually make memes, journals, or have a youtube/instagram/twitter account dedicated to their favorite group. Usually cool and chill. Always making new things!Ready for battle - a warrior who will do anything to defend their group from attack (be it a nice or rude way). If they go on offensive, they usually start a fan war.Multi fandom - stans more than one group, and always open to stanning more. They keep an eye rookie groups to see what the next biggest thing will be.Merch king - collects everything related to their group. Clothing, albums, photo cards, posters, light sticks, figurines. You name it and they will most likely have it. Like a king, they seem to have an unlimited amount of cash to spend…Granny - a fan who has been around since the group’s founding ( or the founding of kpop itself). They have seen the group’s growth over a long period of time. May or may not have rare merchandise lying around. Infinitely wise and understands the workings of the kpop industry in depth.Baby - a fan who has joined a fandom very recently. Still getting their footing in the world of kpop. Still confused as to who’s who and what a ‘bias wrecker’ is .Delusional fan - thinks that they will accidentally bump into Junkook, fall in love, get married and -Worshipper - thinks that ___ idol is God incarnate and will follow said idol’s group religiously. They dedicate their life to this group, and it is ride- or- die scenario. They usually are a one group stan. They think their idol is the purest person to ever exist.Dirty minded fan - kind of gross and has weird Asian fetish. Writes sexual fanfiction in their spare time. Also says ‘oppa’ and ‘noona’ a lot.Professional translator - the amazing bilingual people that translate all the group’s videos for international fans. Can speak both languages fluently.Koreaboo - throws away their own culture in order to become one with Korea. Tries to learn Korean, act like a Korean, and eat like a Korean?? You get the point. Usually it’s because they saw kpop and thought Korea culture = Kpop.Sasaeng - they shouldn’t even be called a fan. Saesangs don’t respect personal space or privacy of the idol they stalk. Will hack or pay money to buy an idol’s phone number, and will try to get into the idol’s dorm, etc etc.Secret fan - they are a huge fan of a group, but they mostly keep it to themselves. Only close friends and family know about this. Incognito and barely talk about it in public.Language enthusiast - wants to learn a new language because of their favorite kpop group. Usually it’s because companies won’t add subtitles for their international fans *cough *cough*Clout fan - will follow a group because it is super popular at that time. Most of them don’t stick with group, and when the popularity dies down, they will leave.Charitable fan - will share the wealth and help other fans out by giving away freebies, helping them get merch etc. They also donate to charitable cause in the name of their group.Antis - hate a group so much that they are willing to buy albums and posters just to destroy them. They will leave nasty troll comments under the video.Analytical fan - to them it’s all about comparisons and numbers and this group vs. that group. Ex.This group got this many awards at Mama 2019 vs, this group. This rookie will win Roty because this number digital sales, albums sold, social media influence. This mv got 50 million views..Spill the Tea fan - always trying to find and explain the latest scandal in the kpop world. Unafraid to say their opinions. Makes a whole video about their popular ‘unpopular’ opinions. Knows the dark side of the kpop industry in detail.Vortex fan - gets sucked into the kpop world and can’t get out of it. To put it simply, they are addicted to kpop in an unhealthy manner. They lose time with their friends and family due to kpop. Their wallet also takes a hard hit and they become broke.Kpop vs. real life - fan - loves kpop to death, but also realizes that there is a world outside of kpop. They are also able to balance the time and money spent on kpop with the time and money needed for other things. An admirable feat of willpower!Whew! That was a long list. It’s always interesting to see how each person is affected by kpop, whether it’s a good or bad thing for them. Remember kpop is fun, but it’s not your whole life. Don’t forget to spend time with your family and friends too. Thanks for reading!

The Normal Fans: The ones that don’t center kpop around them, very friendly, easy to talk to, quite open minded, casually or mostly listens to kpop, doesn’t obsess so much over their idol, goes to concerts, supports their idols in a safe way, tries not to shove their group down your throat. Is usually okay with those not agreeing with them.The Bandwagon Fans: With the rise of international popularity in the Western world, a lot of these have emerged. Will use Kpop, for clout, and will hop on if its trendy, probably only listens to 3 songs of kpop that they actually like. Will say they like kpop to get you interested, is usually a celebrity or Youtuber, and possibly someone you’re in a relationship with. Will only say things you want to here about kpop. Not actually interested in the genre, could care less actually.The Koreaboos: With the influence of kpop, they want to think they are Korean, will only know several Korean words and implements those words in an English sentence that is cringey and doesn’t make any sense, probably does their make up like Koreans.The Obsessive Fans: Will center 75% of their life around kpop, keeps up with kpop more than anything else, kpop is probably the topic that will come out of their mouths the most, will spend most of their money on kpop even if they knew they don’t have it. Their obsession is usually quite unhealthy for themselves, as they may update their kpop twitter all day long, may not have that much sleep because they want to keep up with kpop.The Sasaengs: Are 5 steps above the obsessive fans. Their whole world centers around their idols, will fly or move to the location where their idol is (or will want to be around them constantly). They will stalk, attack, send nasty and ridiculous gifts to their idol. Will try and hack into their idols stuff, may attempt to kidnap their idol. Very disgusting and unhealthy behavior. An extremist.The Worshipers: Will worship their idol, puts them at a high pedestal, very delusional, thinks that their idol is the most perfect in the world, very defensive, probably lights candles around their idol, forgets their idols are human, forget their idols cannot be touched, in a relationship etc.The Creative Fans: Usually is quite the artist, will draw a lot of fan art, or write fanfiction (although some fanfiction is very inappropriate and creepy)The Fantasize Fans: Their are either fans who fantasize in wanting to meet their idol, and fans who sexually fantasize about their idol (usually its a bit too much)The Multifandom Fans: Very open minded, loves learning about new groups, supports many groups, probably quite broke but still manages, usually very nice.The Mean/Rude Fans: Literally in every possible fandom existent, whether it is kpop related or not. Very defensive, bash other groups , may bully other fans, very toxic, may only like one group or one member and puts other groups and other members down, close minded, usually starts fanwarsThe Rich Kpop Fans: I’ve seen these people at my college, usually doesn’t have a job, literally will go to as many kpop concerts as they can (not saying those who are working can’t do this), go and travel Asia and Korea, may have a lot of merch.The Fetishsizing Asian Fans: These fans will usually be outside of Asia and will only date or are only interested in Asian women or men. Probably will go further and only want to date Korean men or women, because of their love for kpop. Very unhealthy way of thinking and kinda rude and offensive.

The Bandwagon fans Only joined for the hype.Has trouble recognizing the members of *insert group*.“So, are Jimin and Jungkook, like the same person with different stage names or… what?”Deep down doesn’t like it but it’s what’s popular so whatever.Annoying as hell.The Newbie fans Only stans BTS and maybe Blackpink as well.Also has trouble recognizing members.Doesn’t understand why there are little to no opposite-gender interactions between idols.Probably stans Jungkook or some other commonly biased idol. No shade though.“BTS paved the way!”The Koreaboo fan Obsessed with KoreansTries to “become” Korean.oNiOnHahsaYyoO“OpPaR wIll mArRy Me aNd lOve mE!!111!1!”Bit of a superiority complex disguising that insecurity.Only knows K-pop and K-dramas.Confuses Japenese culture with Korean culture.Highly disrespectful to Koreans and Asians, in general.“I’ll never date someone who isn’t KoReAN!!!11!!1”The Superfan Pretty wealthy.Goes to concerts, fanmeets, and other events every chance they get.Buys ALL their merch.Streams their music as if it’s a matter of life or death.OT*whatever*s 90% of the time.“If you don’t stan all the members then don’t call yourself a fan.”Most likely a multistan.Crackheads.The Average fan Pretty chillGoes to concerts when they have the time and money on occasion.Simply here to support their idols.May or may not think the fandom is a cancer cell.Soft stans the majority of the time; could be hard stans but they keep it hidden out of respect for their idol and/or for their reputation.Has some merch; that is if they have money.Almost unheard of by non-fans.The Sasaeng fan Oh dear god.They can be very wealthy so they can pay for flights with their idols or pay for private information about their idols.Stalk them in their private life.Creepy as fuck.I don’t even think they should be classified as fans.Extremely disrespectful and gross to their idols.Honestly, they have no life.Cancel them ASAP.The fake fan Similar to the bandwagon fans when it comes to the hype around K-pop.Possibly solo stans.“Here are my unpopular opinions about K-pop” *starts criticizing everything to do with it*“Jimin should lose weight.”“Jennie is lazy.”“Hwasa is ugly.”More bullshit.They disrespect the idols but also claim to love them.Must be canceled ASAP.The Thirsty fans Stan Twitter.Wattpad and Tumblr.“OMG His fucking hip thrust.”“Can he please crush my head with his thighs.”Crackheads.💦🍆🍑🌊❤️🍑🍆🌊hOLY WATER.Sometimes goes overboard with the sexualization and can be pretty gross towards their idols.SMUT SMUT SMUT SMUT SMUT SMUT SMUT SMUT SMUT-If they like BTS, they are probably Jimin-biased. Let’s be honest.The “AM BBY” fans “OMG HE’S SO CUTE.”SEDRFCTVYGBUHNJKKKLHard stans scare them.Loves when their idols do aegyo.Stan Twitter.Their usernames have UwU or an emoji in them.Sometimes go overboard with babying their idols despite them being adults with needs like anyone else.Crackheads.The Crackhead fans Stan Twitter.Stan Twitter.Stan Twitter.DID I MENTION STAN TWITTER????“It’s 4:05 in the morning i’M WAITING FOR THE COMEBACK WHERE ARE MY BOYS????”Cursed K-pop images.     *insert key smash here*“EYE-”“The fact that/Remember when/When/etc. *insert member* did *insert action* is the reason I don’t sleep at night.Probably uses Wattpad and Tumblr too.The Delulu fans “nO hE’S mInE!!!111!!”Thinks they’re going to date their idols.Babys the fuck out of their idols like they’re not older than them.They are probably 12–15 years old.Cringey as fuck.They need to be canceled ASAP.Alright, that’s a handful! Bye bois Stay chill 🌹

Since I m now getting more active on twitter I m going to list type of twitter Kpop fans or stans. Retweet sucker - My ability is 100 retweets pr 5 minutes, I gain followers from retweeting ,I WILL RETWEET ON YOUR EXISTENCE. Memer -Saving the whole Stan twitter thing, some heroes don't wear capes, have Kpop memes for your funeral. fancam enthusiast - A nation dispute discussion thread is going on? Who cares look at my bias thighs to clean your soul. Intellectuals- has tattood 'diplomatic ' on their chest, tries to stop toxicity but nobody cares *cries* Sue the company 24/7- "ThE CoMpaNY is milking money out of my oppas and noonas ,next if they don't give my bias my favorite hair color I am suing them" Ambitious Goal setters - have a doctorate degree in music charts,have dreams of billboard in their sleep, have already set goals for the group 2024 comeback. Dying every second cuz of their bias squad- "look how " insert idol's name" is breathing oH My GoD My soUl ! I caNt....... I am so fed up gang- They are done with everything, tweets every other day that they are leaving twitter but tweets in next 25 minutes but they are done Ohk!! Toxic solo stans- They are the worst,"how dare they gave this color to this member when they know it's my bias's favorite duhh" have tottood "mistreated " on their foreheads. The omnipresent squad- they are present every freaking where, first they are seeking justice for their group next they are posting edits,wait they are shutting delulus,oh no now they are making Strategies. If they get a dollar for everytime they tweet,they would have surpassed Bill Gates by now. The *sips tea* squad - Earlier they have joined twitter with another agenda but now they are done and only watches and enjoys the drama.  Bonus - The lost ones (not literally)- They comment on every group's post with “your group could never... or my group has/is more........... ” starting fanwars in 3 2 1…and are need to be reminded everytime that they are in the wrong section. So do you match with any of the above types? Stan twitter is a whole circus.. ~peace

The Newbie - Knows the current most popular bands. Still getting their feet wet in the music and exploring.  The Bandwagonner — Guys, there's nothing wrong with bandwagonners. Kpop is becoming popular all over the world. If they just heard of it now and wants to get into it, give them the chance. No need to bash them and accuse them for being here the popularity. We all want Kpop go far right??  The Low-Key Fan - Got introduced to Kpop, but didn't like it too much. Listens to a couple songs here and there.  The Akgae - Stans ONE person from a group, disregards the efforts of everyone else. The OT(Insert # of members here) Stan - Stan the full group or get out.   The Passionate One-Band Stan - Basically thinks all the other groups are inferior to their faves.  The Office Worker - They love all groups from and are loyal to ONE agency.   Multi-fandom Fellow - Generally open-minded and follows several groups passionately. I don't know how you guys do it...following two groups is already stressful for me :( Props to you, who can keep up though!  The Warrior - Easily triggered and engages in fanwars.  The Oppar-Please-Marry-Me Fan- Not necessarily a sasaeng, but this one believes that their favorite Kpop group belongs to the fans only. It's hard for them to share their biases with others. Dating is also a sin and they might unstan if someone from their favorite group starts to do so, openly. Although I used the term, “oppar” (yes, the r is intended), fanboys can be the same way.   Koreaboos - Tries to look and act like Kpop idols.  Sasaengs - If you know, you know. These guys aren't fun... SNS Addicts - Busts their lungs tweeting/posting, hashtagging, voting, etc. Meme Creators - :D The Toxic Ones - ALL fandoms have them - it’s not just Kpop.  YouTubers - Usually have good content explaining songs, music videos, dance choreos, crack videos, unhelpful and helpful guides to group XX, etc.   The Commentators - They either have something really funny to say or really rude to say in the comments underneath the YT videos. The Kpop Is Lyfe Fan - Self-explanatory. The Should-Be Kpop Star - Make covers of songs and choreos. Usually have amazing vocals or really good at dancing. They are fans with fans. The Chill Fan - They keep to themselves. Fangirl/boy when necessary. Usually enjoy groups on their own and don’t interact much with other fans. The Responsible Fan - Kpop is good. They listen to it frequently and are up-to-date, but Kpop is not lyfe. The Secretive One - Knows a lot about Kpop, but keeps it under wraps. No one would have ever suspect that they were into Kpop.  The Scholar - Knows a lot about Kpop, not just the current bands and the music, but also the history behind it and first/second generation groups. Usually kind and willing to share their knowledge with others. The Nice Ones - Yeah, they exist. Hallyu Wavers - Spreads Kpop throughout the world. May or may not annoyingly blast Kpop music in people’s ears. If they are nice, they will just show you a couple Kpop music videos if you don’t know Kpop. If you like it, they’ll share more. If you don’t like it, the good ones will stop. …. Those are just a few. I know Kpop fans get a lot of negative attention, but FYI, we’re not all that bad. Kpop unites a lot of people from different walks of life - you’ll never know who you will meet. Kpop fans are a diverse bunch, who are generally nice and normal, just like anyone else. It’s just that we’re hyped over Kpop - just like soccer/football fans are hyped over soccer/football, Harry Potter fans are hyped over Harry Potter, Gamers are hyped over video games, etc. Good day!

Questions like this are always hard to answer, because each fan is different. Each of them is their own person and they don't always fit into categories. Generally, the types of k-pop fans aren't that different from the types of fans in other (musical) fandoms, but some of them are a little more devoted/obsessed. There are many ways to categorise fans and the following is just how I would do it. Normal/chill fans: Listen to their songs, watch some of their interviews, love them, don't start beef with other fans or fandoms. Sasaeng fan: really obsessed with them, stalks them, causes a lot of problems, is disliked/hated by the the rest of the fandom. Calm fans: like the music, but don't overreact when their idol(s) release something new. Devoted fans: a less extreme version of sasaeng fans, spend most of their time watching them, reading fanfics, learning everything they can about them, aren't afraid to defend their faves. They also always vote on award shows. Annoying/Superior fans: think their idols and fandom are the best, regularly insult other fans/idols, comment about their faves on every single post or video. Creative fans: write fanfictions, make fanart and etc. Overreacting fans: go crazy when something new comes out or they see their faves somewhere. New fans: just joined the fandom, constantly ask who is who. Cover fans: make song or dance covers. Secret fans: don't tell anyone about their fandom and keeps everything to themselves. “There from the start” fans: often like to tell newer fans they are "fake fans" because they haven't been there as long as them, could own a lot of albums and have been to many concerts. K-Pop fans are also divided into international and Korean fans International fans: can wait days/weeks for subs, some always ask them to speak english, rarely get to see their faves live. Korean fans: can go to a lot of concerts, help international fans, vote on award shows.

The new fansWait, so that’s Jin and that’s Jimin? They have really similar names (I actually thought this when I started liking BTS…)Which one is Jungkook?*Doesn’t know any inside jokes*The chill fans“Oh, it’s ok if you don’t listen to K-pop. Just don’t call me a Koreaboo”Is chill about their music preferences (as stated in the name)Fake/toxic fans“I WILL GET THE ENTIRE SCHOOL TO LISTEN TO BTS EVEN IF I DIE DOING IT!!”“You need to memorize all their faces and names. When are you going to do that? How many songs have you listened to? Is that E N G L I S H M U S I C I hear? Garbage.”“Jisoo is a bad singer”“I unstanned Blackpink because they’re bad singers and Rose and Lisa are underweight.”“Jimin needs to stop being an attention seeker.”They constantly criticize idols no matter whatSasaengs/Delusional “fans”No.Absolutely insane“I WILL SWIM TO KOREA TO MARRY MY OPPAR”*Breaks into hotel rooms*Some literally write letters with their own bloodMost likely has some mental problem“OMMMMMMGGGGGG JUNGKOOK LOOKED AT ME DURING A CONCERT!!! THE WEDDING IS TOMORROW!!”“I have to look good for my oppar” Koreaboos/Obsessive fans“I need to learn to speak Korean for when I bump into Jimin on the streets” (Not bashing anyone who actually wants to learn the language for legitimate reasons)Eats Korean food onlyMost likely has mountains of merch“Sarang me oppar. Be my namjachingu” (I cringed typing this. Be right back, I need a dose of Holy Water)Dedicates almost all their life to K-popCrackheadsCursed images Is up at 4 AM making memes in the dark corner of their roomIf anyone saw the memes they make, they would be scared And finally…Thirsty fansOh noComprised of 12–13 year old Monbebes“WONHOOOOOOOOOOOOOEEEEEE”I can’t type anymore. I just can’t bear to do it…

upvoters.user_id: Once you Taemin You Can't Taemout

response.answer_text: please keep in mind that i’m only covering the basics, i left out a lot here enjoy! ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ the standard k-pop stan ~has probably been into k-pop for 1–3 years ~stans a few different groups ~somewhat to pretty active in their group activities ~gets confused on who is who from time to time, but generally can tell members apart ~relatively pretty nice and friendly  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ the koreaboo ~disliked by a lot of k-pop stans ~a bit annoying, depends how much ~obsessed with looking/acting korean ~favorite phrase is “OPPA SARANGHAE!1!1!1!1!1!” [insert gagging sound here] ~sometimes are trolls, meaning they’re actually just pretending to be a koreaboo  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ the akgae (a fan who only likes one member of a group and hates all the rest of the members) ~one of the worst kind of stans in k-pop ~toxic, often engages with fanwars ~tries to bring down the other members of the group through rumors ~overall, not a type of fan you want to meet  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ sasaeng stan ~creepy af ~doesn’t respect their idol’s personal space ~thinks they deserve to marry whoever it is they stalk (hint: they don’t) ~sometimes only acting the way they do for clout ~just plain annoying  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ the new stan ~typically isn’t very familiar with k-pop yet ~usually gets very confused ~always asking, ”who is who????” ~usually ok  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ the shy one ~doesn’t engage in many activities with other fans ~most of the time keeps it to themselves that they like k-pop ~can be new or a long-timer  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ the multi-stan ~usually good people, as long as they don’t bring any other groups down ~most of the time respects people’s opinions ~easy to get along with ~does not commonly engage in fanwars  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ok so that’s it thanks for reading bye

OH MY GOD THE MIC DROP REMIX!!! Ahem. Now that right there was my type of fangirling. I was that one regular fan who shouts and squeals over it and doesn't stop thinking about it. I think there are many types of kpop fans but I don't know how you would categorize them. The one that freely expresses itBy this I mean that one kpop fan who talks about it without fear of being judged by non kpop fans, the ones that talk about kpop with other kpop fans in class without any problems. These types of fan can come off as annoying if they talk about it too much and come off as the really obsessive and passionate type or the chill one. It's like a sub sub part of this category.That one dirty fanYeah, the one who sexualizes kpop idols. They can either be the normal like a pervert in those animes, or really that bad to the point where they tweet or mail it to their Kpop idols or something. Or they could just be that one smutty fanfic writer.The dedicated, hardcore, fanReally passionate, supports their groups, puts their groups first before anything else I supposeMultistan vs One group StanThen here comes the passionate one groups stans who ONLY stan one group and think they're everything until they start becoming multistan. Typically these one group stans are…Kpop newbiesNew vs Old Kpoppers“Remember back when they blah blah blah” then the new ones be like “Who's who? Why do they all look the same? What's aegyo?”That one kpop shipperThat one passionate fan with moneyGot the money to spend for merchandise…I wish i had that.Fake FanAka Saesangs, the one who ignores all the other members except for one (it's not exactly bad bad bad but when this fan tells the other members to go away just to see that one member, their fake. AKA INCIDENT WITH JHOPE V LIVE) the one who loves to troll, the one who says that this group is better than another and puts them down, is rude…The fan that listens to their musicNot bad they know a lot of the groups song but don't exactly stan the group and fandom.Normal fanJust a fan? I don't know haha

match”→ creators does fanartcovers songsmakes dance tutorialsmakes MV analysis videosmakes MV reaction videosmakes crack compilation videosmakes guide videos for new fansmakes aesthetic trailers / lisa breathed in jungkook’s direction!! omg liskook is real”“jimin stop trying to steal jungkook away from taetae >:(“→ mom fans feels proud of their idols like they are their childrenhas the urge to take care of and protect them (super defensive)calls them pet namesalways worried about their health→ koreaboos wants to move to korea and marry their idolskeeps insulting their own racethinks everyone in korea looks like a supermodelwants pale skin to “look korean”pretends to love korean food“annyeonghaseyo chingudeul!! saranghae juseyo kekekekeke”this was a fun answer to write :) hope you enjoyed!

The Newbie FanYou guessed it, newbies. They usually just know the popular groups like BTS, Blackpink, or Twice. Really flammable, they could explode anytime if someone insult their biases. 2. The Veteran Fan They're into kpop since dinosaur age and basically knows everything about the good and bad of kpop industry. They noticed that every idols debuting is younger than them😭😭 3. The Author They write fanfics. Some are amazingly good and some is bad. Newbie fan could be an author too. 4. Masternim A fan who devote their life to follow their idol's activities and take a bunch of pictures and videos of them. Overseas fan's savior. 5. The “You Don't Even Know That I'm Alive But ILYSM” Fan. Yup, it's us international fans. 6. Celebrity Fan It's a celebrity that is an idol's fan. 7. Fanart Maker Fan They make fanarts. 8. Sasaeng Fans Batshit crazy creepy stalkers. 9. The “… Only” Fan One fandom for eternity. 10. The “Fandom? More Like A Cult” Fan. You can't love another idols other than (insertgroupnamehere). If you leave you're a traitor. 11. The “Everyone Is Oppa” Fan.  Yeah. This is 100% accurate. 12. The “Streaming Streaming” Fan. YouTube 24/7, make multiple accounts. 13. The Rich Fan  They're buying concert ticket like a candy. Room full of OFFICIAL kpop merchs. 14. The “I Must Sell My Kidney To Attend Oppa's Concert” Fan.  Help us :( 15. The Casual Fan The one that isn't involved in all the kpop fandom craziness. Only listen to kpop but not actively obsessing over kpop. 16. The “I've Fallen Into The Kpop Hole So You Should Too” Fan. It's a fan that always talk about kpop 24/7 around people who isn't a kpop fan, blasting kpop music everywhere anytime. 10/10 will force their non kpop fan friends to watch several kpop mv atleast 5 times a day. 17. The “I Want To Get Out From Kpop But I Can't” There's so many of them in my country. They start deleting anything kpop related but ends up failed. Absolutely losing their mind when their bias have a comeback. 18. The “Absolutely Kpop Trash” Fan. They know like almost every kpop songs existed. 19. The Kpop + Kdrama Fan. They love kdramas as much as they love kpop.

DONT do shit like read wattpad stories and smut and obsess over their idol like I wanna marry him/her DON’T say shit like don't stan them, ot6, etc. they r friendly not a cut-throat bitch or a dick. they just casually be enjoying kpop tbhR I C H F A N S YO these bitches be having all the merch and they be flexin harddd boi they also go to concerts have fn nice clothes kpop inspired they have all the kpop shit you wanted but your broke ass couldn’t get. periodtS A S A E N G S these ppl hella crazy a fkn whole new world above obsessive fans: stalking, taking photos, attack the idols, send ridiculous gifts pic, will try to call msg, attempt kidnapp. just crazy ass bitches that hella fkn disgusting will do anything. VERY BAD PPLC R E A T I V E A R T S A N D C R A F T S they do be making creative merch themselves like postcards design cool i mean amazing stuff abt kpop bullet journalling OMG the people who make food like the cake pancakes sick as. they draw paint edit photos.E X P L O R E F A N S They start off with kpop and explore and go into stuff like krnb hip hop lofi pretty cool people most of them end up sticking with krnb,k-lofi,korean chill mix/music.

The Newbies: “THEY ALL LOOK THE SAME 😭”Casual fans: Listens to the music but doesn't really keep up with the variety shows, memes, inside jokes, chillSoft stans: innocent, freaks out at any dirty jokesHard stans: 19+ thoughts, need holy water, calls their oppar daddy, tbh just look at monbebes for detailsAkgaes: solo stans, only in for one person and can't stand the rest of the members, heavily biased and will shit on the other members in their oppar's favourKoreaboos: their own culture isn't enough for them, learns Korean just to marry their oppar's, adds Korean words and phrases in every sentence regardless of whether the recipients get it or not, unironically do aegyo after watching idols do it as part of “fitting into Korean culture”, responsible for my braincells committing suicideDelulus (normal version): fully convinced their oppar/eonnie/noona are their soulmates, get furious when the idol starts dating and send them hate online, overlaps with koreaboos, sends their faves partners hate, insane double standards, delulus fuck off challengeDelulus (sasaeng version): WORSE THAN NORMAL, stalker fans, will do anything to make sure oppar/eonnie/noona will be theirs alone, have sent their faves letters written in blood, attempted kidnapping their faves, dangerous, SASAENGS GO STRAIGHT TO JAIL CHALLENGEFansites: fans who take pictures of idols (1 member in particular usually) during concerts or in airport and upload them on social mediaContent creators: fanfics, fanart, fmvs, song and dance covers, pic edits, all uploaded on social mediaAntis: spend more time bashing other groups than focusing on their faves, poster children for jobless

There are wayyyy too many fans and all are very different from each other but I’ll just give you the main ones I know and have seen. The newbies. These are the ones who have just joined a fandom like 2 weeks ago and are still trying to get to know the band members and the fandoms ‘inside jokes’. Every one grows out of that one easily.The Oldies. Fans that have been a fan of a band since their debut or just for a long time. Pretty self explanatory. Now some of these oldies fall into certain categories for example.The loyal fan: One who always supports every decision a member or the whole band makes and will fight those who ever try to hurt their children. They are the ones who buy the albums which is the reason these fans are broke ;( and also stream 24/7 so who needs sleep am i right?? (jks pls rest)‘Sasaeng’ fans: Those who have been in the fandom for a while however they soon become obsessed to the point where they start to stalk their idols everywhere. You hear them on the news saying they tried to come close to an idol in an airport or they follow them into their private home and sometimes even put cameras in places such as toilets, bedrooms. PLEASE DON’T BE THIS FAN!! No offence to any but you can be a fan just don’t get into your idols personal lives. They are still people after all!I know there are way more so I recommend you watch this video that tells you more fans (not just in BTS but for every band/kpop idol out there)

There is the fan who doesn’t talk about K-POP much, but if someone wears a shirt of a group (or mixtape) that you Stan you ask them who their bias is. This is the type of fan thatI am personally. There is/ was a girl at my school (don’t know what grade she was in) she had a shirt with RM’s mixtape “Mono” and we had a conversation about our biases (her’s is V and mine is Suga). There is a girl who I met on September 29, 2019 and her bias is RM. Another type is the Sasaeng fan. Sasaeng are SO obsessed with their idols that they stalk the, maybe even harm them. The third type of fan I’m going to mention are Solo Stans. They ONLY “love” one member and hate the rest. The fourth type are OTx (number of members minus 1) fans. They believe M (member) doesn’t belong in G (group). The fifth type are Multi fandom stans. This is another type of fan that I am. They like multiple groups not just one. The sixth type of fan are shippers. They say X is in love with Y. The types that I mentioned are only some of the types of fans.

NEWBIES  New to this whole kpop experience Most of them imagine they are going to date their oppas  Asumes vlive belongs to V (BTS) Are confused about literally everything They are the nicest ones tbh.  KOREABOOS  The most annoying ones  Literally plans on settling in S. Korea just so they get to meet their idol Tries adopting the whole Korean culture Eats in chopsticks only because they want to be like Koreans (also note,learning Korean does not mean being a koreaboo.)  BBACKBONE Kpopies  Ok,these are the most important ones They set up streaming goals ,records,plans for comebacks Informs everyone about the upcoming things,updates about everything Can be mostly found in Twitter with high ass followers.  THE ENTERTAINERS   Also the most important ones. They make memes,edits and most importantly fanarts. Literally make the whole experience of stanning more fun. These are the ones who also make something like stanning productive too  THETHE MANAGERS  Ugh. They think they own their idols. Have problem with everything and are unnecessarily over protective High key need to realise their idols are grown ass adults and will do whatever the hell they want Even have problems when their idols colllab with someone they don't like Literally the epitome of ughhh  THETHE SHIPPERS  The most delusional ones Over analysers Even breathing the same air means their delulu ass ship is real And if they make an eye contact for 0.0001 seconds,omg they married. Goes on making theories on how using the same pen means they are married with 5 kids.  THETHE OBSESSED ONES  Goes on buying every merch they release,every album their ult produces Owns all the possible stuff related to their ults  Buys every thing their idol uses,touches or sees.  THE CRAZY ONES   Well,where do I start Cancels people for not liking a flavour of ice cream. Extremely sensitive,even an emoji can get on their nerves Extremely toxic too Always the ones participating in fanwars Thinks their idols owes them something for creating negativity around them  THE SILENT ONES  Well,they are..silent? They just listen to their music,watch videos and well that's it Don't bother participating in anything and also stan many groups,they don't participate in any streaming but still celebrate the success. Let me know if I left any.

the newbies newbie: ‘ahh bts are having a comeback!’older stan: ‘so are twice, astro, etc…’newbie: ‘wHo aRe tHeY??’‘how do u even recognise their voices they sOunD tHe sAme’‘im dating jungkookie oppar’fake stans omg im an army but *members name* doesnt belongonly knows title tracks‘*group name* is superior every other group is tRaSh’solo stan (the good ones) likes one member only, but RESPECTS the other membersdoes NOT consider themselves as a fan of the group as they only like one memberthese people are usually misinterpreted as akgaes :/solo stans (akgaes) *sees concept photo* ‘omg *member’s name* looks the best the others look so much worse’will degrade other members in the groups to make their faves look better smhwill ONLY praise that one member and wont acknowledge the others at allgood stans respects all groupsspreads love not hateis willing to be helpful to other stans without calling them ‘fakes’ when they are just new to the fandom (this is just an example lol essentially just being helpful)sasaengs scary.creepy.will have plans to actually date an idolwill stalk themplease we dont need sasaengs~stayarmyUPDATE: THANK YOU GUYS SO MUCH FOR 100 UPVOTES THIS MEANS SO MUCH TO ME <3

The Newbies — Yeah, you already know sjhsjsjs The Crackheads — they are making your daily memes, be proud lmao… The Hardstans — thiRStY 24/7 The Softstans — most likely have a really aesthetic Instagram thread account. 😔 (that's me 👁👄👁) The Obsessive — stalking idol profiles, stalking them in person, going everywhere their idol has been, wearing everything their idol has worn, etc. -_- The Koreaboos — “saRaNGhaE oPPa~^^” The Dancers — s k i l l e d periodt. The Artists — talented. Just talented. The Journalists — they're so talented and aesthetic too like omg- The Streamers — yeah ykyk The Weeb — they probably have a lot of anime pictures of idols- Edit :: The Singers — Their covers are legit so cool and they could be a k-pop idol one day 😔 or singer. The Casual/Normal Fans — They just listen to their songs stream, have a ton of memes, soft or hard photos. Knows a lot. 😌 The Toxic Ones — All I can say is begone please. I understand that you're tryna defend something, but calm down- Did I miss any???

Mic drop? Ahaha.. Tho i dont know how the mv/song relates to your question, ill just answer since you asked. There are so many types of fans, and one cant generalize or group them into specific categories(or they may) but just the basic like demographics ● age range ● gender ● statuses (ex. Students, working people, single, married) ● country they live in But if this question what’s to dig deeper such as personality & or behaviors. It would be hard. Coz aside from different races and culture, each and every fan has their own standards & behavior. Tho if one wants to observe the behaviors they can do so by observing how fans are within the fandom via sns (twitter, fb, IG, tiktok, kakao et al)or other media like YT/,Tumbler, Blogs, Amino app, Wattpad. However be advised that these fan behaviors are specific to one or group of fans (so avoid generalizing). Behaviors like ● extreme idolization ● stalking ●obsession ●possessivenes ●childishness/immature ●mature ● casual (fans) ● positive dedication ● charitable ● open-minded (which are more often mistaken as being multi-stan) ● friendly/fam like/amiable ●moderately supportive ● loud &/or hysterical ● quiet/timid ● keyboard warriors (yes, keyboard warriors arent just construed around haters and trolls, but also fans too) ● diplomatic ● manipulative ● feelers ● rude & or condescending (w/c some fans told me i am.hahaha) ● those who just go with the flow or likes to join the mob/herd mentality ● spoiled (brats) ● superiority complexes ● the ever always worrying ● assumptives /nosey ● fanfic writers ● the know it all ● imaginary lovestucked (yeah not love strucked) ● delulus ●horder ● the closet sex delulus/ loves pointing and talking about their faves private parts ● the theorist ● the drama makers ● the fanwars, gossip, fakenews instigators ● the always on the road (always concert, event, fansign goers) ● the advocates ● the mediators ● the apologists (pfff.. If others dont mess up, no need for the apologists, but then) ● the always i-dont-care ● and of course, the shippers ● the antis ● the haters Ahhh.. Should i write more? Nah.. Ill just end it here.

These are the ones I’ve seen before: The sasaengs: In South Korean culture, a sasaeng or sasaeng fan (Hangul: 사생팬; Hanja: 私生팬) is an obsessive fan of a Korean idol or other public figure, who has engaged in stalking or other behaviour constituting an invasion of privacy. This type of fans are really annoying. They do something uncomfortable to their idols like breaking into their dorms, chasing them in public, sending period blood with a weird message and basely doing ab-normal things. The general fans: Just normal fans. The creater: This fan makes stuff like fanart, Fan fics, fan videos and merch. I’ve seen this type of fans common among ARMYs. The one who pretend to hate kpop: Oh boy, I’ve seen this type of fans many times. These fans pretend to hate kpop in public but then at home, fangirls like there’s no tomorrow. Fake Fans: This type of fans are toxic. In fact, I’ve met one in person! They basely do toxic things ether/both in public or on internet. The person I met only like Jungkook (from BTS) and didn’t care about the other members. I hope this was hopeful!

There’s the obvious and there’s me. I don’t know how I would be classified. I like it, watch a lot of YouTube vids, but I’m very specific and picky. I’ve been to one concert but I don’t ever buy merch or albums. I vote for groups I like, but I don’t watch all their vlives. I’m not interested in fanservice or shipping and could care less how attractive they are (although I don’t like some of their styles). I’m also really critical, even of groups I like. But I don’t discuss kpop with anyone except my sister and the internet. And… that’s me as a fan :B

I think there are lots of K-Pop fans type out there… Boygroups fans vs Girlgroup fans vs Soloist fansNewbies vs VeteranAkgae (being a fan to only one member of a group) vs Buy-One-Get-All fanNormal fans (those who stream music, buy official merchandises, etc) vs Sasaeng (those who interferes with their idol’s private life everyday)Those who stan underappreciated groups vs Those who stan popular groups10s vs 20s vs 30 and upOld gen fans vs new gen fansLoyal fan vs multifandom hoe…and even more~

•The Youtubers •The Newbie •The solo stan •The multistan •The one who only stans one group •The Koreaboo •The Sasaeng •The streamer •The normal one •The toxic one •The one who’s just here for the music •The niceest kpop fan you’ll ever meet •The Bandwagon one •The one who always starts arguments •The obsessive one
